p: NIH mice were randomly divided into six groups, 12 in each group: normal control group (NC); placebo control group (IAV-C + sterile saline, suspended in 0.5% Tween 80); curcumin groups (H1N1 virus + curcumin 25, 50 and 100 mg/kg); and positive control ribavirin (70 mg/kg). The challenge inoculation of ~ 10 5 50% cell culture infectious doses (CCID 50)/mouse was equivalent to five 50% mouse lethal challenge doses (MLD 50). Under mild anesthesia, mice were infected with 50 μL 15 MLD 50 IAV (sterile in PBS, pH 7.2) intranasally (without the NC group). Then, mice were treated with intraperitoneal injection of curcumin (25, 50 and 100 mg/kg) or ribavirin (70 mg/kg) for 1 day prior to viral challenge and received concomitant treatment for 3 days after infection. On day 4 after infection, the mice were sacrificed to collect relevant samples, and the body weight, lung wet weight, and the degree of lung pathological changes were measured.
